name: triassic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
from or referring to the period of time between around 245 and 208 million years ago, in which dinosaurs (= large reptiles that no longer exist) first appeared: The nests date back 220 million years to the triassic period. Triassic plants
More examplesFewer examplesThe Triassic world was different from today's world.The plants at least only showed significant changes with the rifting of the plates in later Triassic times.Triassic strata under the Cumberland Plain are thicker than in the west.A primitive dinosaur skeleton from Upper Triassic strata was discovered in northwestern Argentina.

the Triassic
the Triassic period (= between around 245 and 208 million years ago): The Triassic was the first of the three geologic periods that made up the Mesozoic. For about 150 million years, beginning in the Triassic, mammals were small and largely inconspicuous.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Triassic began more than 190 million years ago.At the beginning of the Triassic, the dominant land animals were the mammal-like reptiles.By the end of the Triassic, the dinosaurs were the dominant herbivores worldwide.
